stories.text:
Inspired by the discussions goin on in an earlier thread I would like to ask you guys:

What are good review spaces, that are actually produced by somewhat reliable actual human people .

Some of the examples provided:

https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/

https://linusmediagroup.com/

https://www.notebookcheck.net/

H

Gamers nexus

Hardware Unboxed I think the community must know more and better so please post them here.
stories.title: Ask HN: Good review sites and channels by humans
Biotech platforms are out, products are back in

stories.text: As parents we can't be there at all hours of every day. Meanwhile, kids are being introduced to computers earlier and earlier. At some point, they will obtain a computer - maybe you feel it's the right time, or perhaps the grandparents give one as a present unannounced. Once you finally give in and allow them regularly access a computer of their own, how do you - a technical expert - monitor or manage their usage to make sure they don't get accidentally introduced to the darkest parts of the internet (e.g., bad images/videos, conversations with strangers, etc.)?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you monitor your young kids' computer usage?
